isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Engine Electrical - Install - Main Engine Wiring Harness - Engine Mounted ECM

svcproc.title: Main Engine Wiring Harness - Engine Mounted ECM

step1.para: Install and connect IPR in high-pressure pump. See " IPR " in the "High-pressure Lube Oil System" section in this manual, for proper installation procedure for IPR.

note.para: Installation of main wiring harness for front-mount or rear-mount ECM is identical except where noted.

step1.para: If removed, install EOP, ECT, MAP and EOT sensors in their proper locations and tighten them.
Measure CMP sensor clearance, if required. See "Measure CMP Sensor Clearance" in this section.
Place new O-ring on CMP sensor, lubricate O-ring with clean engine oil. Install CMP sensor in front cover with mounting bolt.
Tighten CMP sensor mounting bolt to " Special Torque ."
Apply Loctite™ #277 to ICP sensor threads.
Install ICP sensor with O-ring in supply manifold. Tighten ICP sensor to " Special Torque ."
Carefully inspect each connector. Make sure each connector has its ribbed seal in place. Replace connectors with ribbed seal missing.

note.para: Make sure each connector has its ribbed seal in place before connecting to sensor. In some cases, during disassembly, a ribbed seal may pull out of its connector and remain on the mating socket of a sensor or actuator. A connector assembled without appropriate ribbed seal can become contaminated with moisture and terminals may corrode. This can result in poor electrical connections.

figure.caption: Install ICP sensor in supply manifold

step1.para: Install wiring harness on engine and carefully align connectors to sensors. Push each connector in its mating socket until locking tabs are fully latched.

note.para: When servicing Diamond Logic® controller, application of an approved dielectric grease to disconnected ECM connectors is encouraged. This will provide a protective, moisture tight seal that ensures ECM connectors will continue to perform effectively.

step1.para: Apply 9.5 mm (3/8 in) bead of approved dielectric grease to each ECM connector. Begin applying dielectric grease from bolt moving toward the ends of ECM connectors.
Apply Grease Instruction Label to identify ECM connectors and Diamond Logic® controller has been serviced and sealed with proper grease
Connect engine wiring harness to ECM.

figure.caption: Install engine wiring harness (front mount ECM unit)

step1.para: Tighten retaining screw to " Special Torque ."

figure.caption: Torque ECM connector cover retaining screws (rear mount ECM)
Torque ECM connector cover retaining screws (front mount ECM)

step1.para: Install and connect second wiring harness to ECM. Tighten retaining screw to " Special Torque ."

figure.caption: Install ECM Connector Covers (front mount ECM)
